intro: Behenantha behen, commonly known as Indian buttercup, is a herbaceous plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has compound leaves with serrated edges. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The plant is also noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types, making it adaptable to different environments.
